intro: Premna tahitensis var. vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis premna, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive scent. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, attracting various pollinators. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
